column16: 10.1 - Following the publication, the European Palestinian Network Conference taking place in Denmark on January 11th informed that Hind Rajab Foundation (HRF) that its participation at the conference was canceled after some invitees opposed sharing a panel with the HRF. The HRF noted on X that participation was cancelled "due to information disseminated in the Israeli press, falsely linking us to resistance movements in Lebanon and Palestine." The conference was organized by Puls48, a Palestinian-focused advocacy news site. Speakers at the conference included, amongst others, Mogens Lykketoft Former Minister of Foreign Affairs of Denmark, Francesca Albanese UN Special Rapporteur on the Occupied Palestinian Territories, and Palestinian journalists.

column15:
משרד הביטחון ביטל את זכייתה של חברת 'ארי ארמס' במכרז לאספקת עשרות אלפי רובי סער לצה"ל ובנוסף גם ביטל את המכרז כולו. 
חודש לפני כן חשף תחקיר שומרים כי ארי ארמס שכרה כיועץ למכרז את עו"ד יצחק וכטל שהיה עד לפני שנים ספורות סגן היועץ המשפטי של אגף הרכש והמכרזים במשרד הביטחון. לאחר פרסום המכרז המקורי, שהיה מכרז "סגור", פנה וכטל בשם החברה למשרד וביקש שהמכרז יפורסם מחדש כ"פתוח" על מנת שהחברה תוכל להתמודד בו. המשרד נענה לבקשתו.
column16: The Ministry of Defense canceled the award granted to the company 'ARI ARMS' in the tender for supplying tens of thousands of assault rifles to the IDF, and additionally canceled the entire tender. A month earlier, a Shomrim investigation revealed that ARI ARMS had hired attorney Itzhak Vakhtel as a consultant for the tender; until just a few years ago, Vakhtel had served as deputy legal advisor of the Procurement and Tenders Division at the Ministry of Defense. After the publication of the original tender — which was a ‘closed’ tender — Vakhtel, on behalf of the company, asked the ministry to reissue the tender as an ‘open’ one so that the company could compete. The ministry accepted his request.

שבועיים לאחר פרסום התחקיר הודיעו מנהלי מחלקות בבתי חולים בפריפריה כי הם מפסיקים את המתווה באופן חד צדדי;
חיים התראיין לרדיו צפון על הכתבה
column16: On January 15, 2026: The Ministry of Health announced the establishment of a working team to formulate an updated framework for medical residencies on-call shifts, with the aim of creating a model that can be implemented systemically and sustainably and that addresses the shortcomings identified in the implementation of the current framework. In its announcement regarding the establishment of the team, the Ministry of Health stated that as part of reviews and lessons-learned, it found that the framework has value in easing workload pressures, but at the same time, claims were raised by some stakeholders within the system regarding harm to the quality of training and care, to continuity of treatment, and to the functioning of the departments in which the framework is applied, creating significant disparities in these areas between peripheral hospitals and those in central Israel. Accordingly, the need arose for a thorough review and an update to the working method, while maintaining the goal of reducing the workload on residents. The team is scheduled to submit its recommendations by May 1, 2026.

column15:
היו לכתבה יותר מ-300K צפיות בפלטפורמות הדיגטליות של כאן
שבועיים לאחר פרסום התחקיר, המשרד להגנת הסביבה פרסם להערות הציבור, טיוטת תקנות חדשות שיגבילו  שימוש, ייצור וייבוא של חומרים מסוכנים ממשפחת PFAS. 
התקנות מהוות צעד ראשון לקראת אשרור אמנת שטוקהולם.
column16:
The investigation received more than 300K views on KAN’s digital platforms.
Two weeks after it was published, the Ministry of Environmental Protection released for public comments a draft of new regulations that will restrict the use, production, and import of hazardous PFAS chemicals.
These regulations constitute an initial step toward ratifying the Stockholm Convention.

column16:
Nov 18, The Labor and Welfare Committee held a discussion regarding the failure to transfer the budget for the program. 
Following publication of this article, a group of parliamentarians, led by MK Meirav Ben Ari (Yesh Atid), initiated a discussion on the matter at the Knesset Labor and Welfare Committee. All those present at the meeting, including committee chair MK Michal Woldiger (Religious Zionism), expressed their support for Yizhar’s work. The representative of the National Security Ministry, meanwhile, reiterated that the problem stemmed from the massive cut to the budget of the National Authority for Community Safety – from around 120 million shekels to just 33 million shekels. Nonetheless, after the discussion, the budget was found and the Knesset’s Finance Committee approved its transfer.

column15: בינואר 2026, פרסם משרד החקלאות וביטחון המזון מסלול סיוע ייעודי לרשויות מקומיות לשנים, בעלות של 15 מיליון שקלים, שנועד לאפשר שדרוג ביכולות הטיפול והקליטה של הכלביות העירוניות חלק הניסיון להתמודד עם תופעת הכלבים המשוטטים ומחלת הכלבת, שהתגברו מאוד מאז תחילת המלחמה.
column16: In January 2026, the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security published a dedicated assistance program for local authorities, with a budget of 15 million shekels. The program is intended to enable upgrades to the treatment and intake capacities of municipal dog shelters, as part of an effort to address the phenomenon of stray dogs and rabies, which have intensified significantly since the beginning of the war.
